Reviews.Title: “Airless, dark room !”
Reviews.Author: ron c
Reviews.Content: We were given what must be the worst room in the hotel. The so-called standard rooms do not have a window to the outside world. The windows open onto an air shaft, which is shared with the adjoining building. The room was dark and airless and not a healthy atmosphere for anyone with asthma or similar breathing issues. We would have changed hotels but we were 'trapped' because we had an airmiles hotel voucher and this voucher is for a specific hotel. What made our situation worse was the fact the the manager would not leave his office to speak with us. I tried each day to see him but was told he was out, in a meeting, on the telephone, or on-line.........any excuse for him not to see us. We were asked to pay another e30/night to move to a better room. Beware that there is at least one of this type of room on each floor of the hotel. I don't have any other complaint with the hotel apart from the standard of these rooms and illusive attitude of the manager. But, a hotel is only as good as its manager ........! Draw your own conclusions !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scattercash
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a 3 night break at Le Royal. Excellent staff who speak English but were happy for me to trash their language as well! (Yes, I think I probably do sound like the policeman from 'Allo 'Allo!). Comfortable small-ish room with aircon and minibar at the rear of the hotel was very quiet. Free wifi for all you iPhone addicts and free PC in reception for guest use as well. Satff were happy to store our bags on final day after checking out. Breakfast choice was excellent and plentiful too. Location is fantastic for sightseeing and for getting to/from CDG. The RER. Metro and lots of buses are all close by. We purchased a "Paris Viste" pass from Tourist Info at CDG which covered all our travel by whatever means. Lots of good local eateries - La Rotonde was excellent - fitted us in at 8.30 on a Saturday without booking! We would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh A
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel very clean - rooms are big and breakfast each morning was great! great location as lots of cafes and restaurants in the local area

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good location, small rooms though.”
Reviews.Author: ch98tom
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, very good location. Easy to walk to most of the major sights and in a lovely Breton area of Paris. Room (nr 12) was a little small and the mattress a little uncomfortable but it had a tv and hairdryer and was functional. Breakfast was good with meats, cheese, pastries, eggs, toast, juice, tea, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jvmoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days and the place was beautiful. Very moderately priced, and in such a convenient location (minutes from the metro, with tons of restaurants, etc all within walking distance). The lobby was very modern looking and check in was a breeze. The front desk spoke english and they offered a free morning breakfast (if you woke up early enough). Overall Rooms were very small, and the bathrooms were even smaller. I personally loved the decor throughout, but be careful if you have lots of luggage bc the elevators are small and the stairs were winding. During your stay in France, I highly recommend you try the Crepes, get an expresso at the various cafes, and if you enjoy beers from around the world, I highly recommend the "Desperado". I've traveled quite a bit and have tried tons of beers from all over, and this may have to be my favorite to date. Unfortunately I've been unable to find any west of the atlantic so its something that I look forward to when i travel back to europe. Prices for food was pretty fair, but drinks can get expensive except for wine so be prepared if you're a heavy drinker like myself. Highly recommend you visit Champs Elysees if you like to shop, and get a credit card that doesn't charge international conversion fees (i.e. Capital One offers a free one). The girlfriend bought a few things from LV, and when they offer you the option to convert it to US dollars real time, ask to pay in euros bc you'll get a better exchange rate. I learned the hard way after my first purchase so my loss is your gain. Overall, I would highly recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short break in the week before Christmas. The location of the hotel is ideal, being very close to Metro stations and also very handy for a wide range of restaurants in the area. The hotel staff all spoke English and were very friendly and welcoming as well as being keen to offer recommendations and advice. We were upgraded on arrival from a standard to a deluxe room that was very clean and comfortable as well as being surprisingly quiet as it looked out onto Boulevard Raspail. Breakfast was self service but very good with a wide range of food on offer and no restriction on the amount that could be taken. It was let down by the quality of the coffee and tea which was served from flasks - we resorted to the (free) Nespresso capsules that were available in the lounge - a nice little touch in itself but doubly welcome as a replacement for poor breakfast coffee. Because of the Metro links and easy walking distances we found the location of this hotel suited our trip perfectly and would have no hesitation in booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ΑΚΡΙΒΗ Κ
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in very charming location at montparnasse. I loved the lobby and the room decoration. We were upgrated from a standard to a deluxe room without any charge! The reception was very helpfull and polite.Free internet access was very convenient!They even had a nespesso machine at the lobby with tablets to serve yourself an espresso!And a shoe polish device! We didn't use it, but we appreciated the thought!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Asiana14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood. Just walk aroud the corner and there are some nice restaurants. ( a litle bit further there are also some nice pancake restaurants too) Metro station is nearby. The hotel has got a good ambiance and the decoration is very nice. It all looks very well maintained. Breakfast is simple but perfect. Rooms are nice but tiny. You just have enough space to walk around the bed. Also a very small bathroom. Only possible to accomodate one person at a time. Wireless internet acces in the room was good. Tip: Don't want to do all the things you find in a common city guide? In bookstores in Paris you can buy Time Out Paris. It's is an english guide that gives you information about the common tourist attractions but also the hottest spots to go to. I bought the 2011 version and found it very helpfull to spot places a local would know of, but is not mentioned in a typical common guide.

Reviews.Title: “Great local location”
Reviews.Author: FJPrieto
Reviews.Content: We arrived Boxing day, and were delighted to be informed we had been upgraded from a standard to a deluxe room....the nearest metro was Vavin which is a direct line from Gare de Nord for those who are travelling on the Eurostar, so no change required which made it fuss free for us. We also brought Metro tickets at St. Pancras info desk to avoid the queuing in the Metro at Gare du Nord so just hopped on to the train and arrived 15 mins later, it is about a 3 min walk from the metro to the station. Staff were lovely and very helpful, asking us if they could book any trips for us. Our "deluxe room" was cosy and very clean with a really comfortable bed (two large singles pushed together). The room had everything we needed apart from tea / coffee making facilities but these were available free downstairs in the lobby. The room also had automated cooling / heating system which you could adjust to suit you. Breakfast was very simple - hams, fresh breads, juice coffee and pastries but fresh and tasty. We walked the area and found some lovely restaurants which served excellent food, although ordering was sometimes a little bit of a mystery (hope for the best theory) with little English in some places. Overall great location, with a free safe available in the room, staff couldn't help enough and our room was excellent. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well located little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrM1981
Reviews.Content: For a weekend in Paris, where we were not going to be spending much time at all in the hotel, this reasonably priced little place was ideal. It is very well located with a plethora of restaurants nearby and good transport links. Our standard room was quite small, but perfectly functional and clean, which is all we needed for this trip. If staying for much longer than a weekend, it might be worth upgrading to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Guibob
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good and no noise feom outside. Good value but don't expect to find the same rooms as in the pictures on the website. Though it is good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Easy to get to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Fiduciagp
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff very friendly and speak english. Room small but very good quiet at the back (41) looks over a school yard. A number of restaurant close by BUT most don't speak English very well AND menus are not in English Nearest metro is Vavin

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: cesar_fiu
Reviews.Content: I can't say a negative word about this place. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The breakfasts were simple but decent. You can't beat the location. Very close to the metro. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly French and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Marnie09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Bréa last Christmas but the hotel was full for our September trip. Air France Holiday Services told us that Le Royal was the "sister" hotel, 1/2 star better and only a block away. It was a great place to stay! The rooms were larger and the staff every bit as nice as Le Bréa. Our rooms were kept very clean by extremely sweet cleaning ladies and the desk staff was always helpful and very nice to us. It is on a busy street but the windows keep out the street noise if you prefer. We love being on the front of the building and hearing all the French sounds with the window open! It is close to the métro, about 3 blocks to Jardins du Luxenbourg, there are many bistros from cheap to expensive in the area. We would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: MyrnaPlantation
Reviews.Content: The hotel is idealy located a short walking distance from all forms of transportation , it is very unique from the outside and at night the purple lights are just beautiful and it stands out. It is very clean with good service, the staff was very friendly and professional and spoke excellent english and provided us with good suggestions and excellent directions .Eric is just great and was especially helpful. TV was mostly in french, CNN and BBC in english. Our room over looked Rasparil blvd. and at night the panoromaic view was breath taking. We were pleased with our room and breakfast was very good. A special thanks to Eric. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and others. Myrna and Madge

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: issysgoddad
Reviews.Content: we recently had a three night stay and had a marvelous stay.the rooms are as youd expect for this type of hotel but are attractive and well equiped a fine breakfast with excellant coffee and pattiserie amongst many other choices,but above all lovely staff who could not have been nicer or more welcoming with special praise for eric whos help enhanced our trip to paris wonderfully.highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Aussiecouple258
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and only a minute walk to underground train station. Average priced Paris hotel with great modern room that included WIFI. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: zuikozoom
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Welcomed by extremely friendly staff who all spoke excellent english. Our room very clean and comfortable and bathroom very clean. Breakfast excellent with plenty of fresh fruit, beverages and choice of alternatives. Good location equidistant from Vavin and Raspail Metro Stations. Less than 5 mins away. If arriving at CDG the Air France le Cars shuttle coach line 4yellow is great value and drops you a 10. Min walk away at Montparnasse Gare. Good Wifi 5MB great for Skype

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mukilteomike44
Reviews.Content: This Hotel pleasantly suprised us with the spacious room, for Europe, good breakfast and it was a very clean facility.The bathroom had a deep tub and strong shower. The Hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and fluent in English. The front desk staff were especially helpful with restaurant recommendations and transportation suggestions. It is very close to transportation and there are numerous restaurants in walking distance. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Les2tous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Le Royal for the second time. From start to finish, the experience was wonderful. Eric, at the front desk, immediately recognized us from our previous stay. He welcomed us warmly and went out of his way to make us feel comfortable. The hotel is clean and attractive; our room was great. Le Royal is centrally located. It's within walking distance of the Jardin du Luxembourg and some wonderful cafés and restaurants. The breakfast was delicious, too! We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireShrews
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed for either walking into nearby central Paris via Blvd St Michel (20 mins) or catching the Metro from one of two nearby stations (2/3 mins). The Montparnasse mainline station is only 10 mins easy walk from the hotel for anyone travelling west or south west and the Metro line No 4 (Raspail station - 2 mins walk) takes you to/from Gare du Nord. Our room was small but well appointed and clean and was at the rear of the hotel (quiet). Hotel staff were smart and very helpful and the breakfasts were adequate (breakfast staff very helpful and cheerful). The area of Montparnasse is simply full of restaurants and we found a particularly good, friendly one on the Blvd Montparnasse - No 145 named L'abri Cotier. It was a 'traditional' French restaurant and we found it to be better and cheaper than a nearby restaurant which we had sampled on the first night of our stay as it was in the hotel's booklet of recommended restaurants. Would not recommend the bistro 'Chez Edgar' on Blvd Edgar Quinet where we had a very poor meal one lunchtime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kez123uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March. Great location for both metro and main train lines. Reception staff really helpful. Room on small side but didnt spend that much time in the room as off exploring! Raclette restaurant opposit hotel is fab- totally worth doing as different experience. Waitress really helpful in trying to explain the menu. Lots of locals eating there which we always take as a good sign for cost and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: shelly48044
Reviews.Content: Very polite staff lovely rooms, great breakfast including english tea a bonus for me as I don't like coffee. Metro stations close by.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shigel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights booked through Air Miles. The metro journey from the Eurostar Station is very direct and quick and the hotel is minutes from Vavin metro station. The hotel has been newly decorated (we could smell the fresh paint) and was ideal in every way for a trip to Paris. The shower in the small bathroom was excellent - one of the best we have experienced in a hotel. The breakfast was absolutely great and the staff very helpful and willing. We also strolled into the City from here, passing through a lovely local market on the Saturday morning. We would certainly choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: beadish
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. Got upgraded to a deluxe room as staying for 3 days. Room16. Clean,lots of space, great beds and large bathroom. Breakfast -bread, cheese, hams,eggs, coffee, tea ,juice. All fresh and well presented. Can't understand the negative reviews,we couldn't fault it. The metro was about 5 mins walk. Will definately stay again when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: MarianSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just been recently refurbished ( still painting while we were there) in lovely modern colours chocolate, gold, purple & silver. Booked this from the reviews on this site and it was well worth it. Our 4 night stay was worth every penny. Our friends had a double room, very clean but very small!!, the bathroom had no bath and a VERY small shower. Fresh towels and sheets every day. Beds were very comfortable.Our room was classed as deluxe. A bit larger with a bath. The only critic of this was the shower was very narrow. It was sometimes difficult to not bang either the shower taps or the shower screen. Very nice, however the room was on the front, main road was very noisy. It was quite warm but we couldn't open the windows because of the noise. The staff were great! The continental breakfast was fresh and tasty.But PLEASE tea/coffee making facilities in our room were greatly missed and the coffee machine downstairs was usually out of milk. Plenty of bars /restaurants nearby and the Metro station of Vavin was 5 mins walk away. The Metro system is great and easy to use. Check the prices at restaurants before you eat, some charge more for sitting outside in the sun rather than inside! One thing about the Metro is that it isn't very disabled or pushchair friendly, there are few or no escalators mainly steps & lots of them! This is sometimes difficult with a suitcase. Other than a nice cup of tea being availble when we woke up the hotel was great and we would stay here again but would definitely request a deluxe room!.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautifully renovated, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: AlexNCollins
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Le Royal. The hotel and rooms were beautifully updated. The location was great -- minutes walk from a couple Metro stations. Staff were extremely helpful when it came to events and directions. The breakfast served was also lovely. I could not be happier with our experience. My only small complaint was that our bed was two single beds pushed together, which wasn't the most comfortable arrangement, but it was very minor. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: MurrayHouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this lovely hotel, it was clean, beautifully furnished with a nice breakfast. As we were staying 5 nights we were upgraded. The room was spacious and the large bathroom had a powerful shower over the bath. The staff were courteous and friendly and the hotel is in a convenient situation for the metro and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comme ci, comme ça”
Reviews.Author: Madame44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister from January 13-19, 2011. Our reservations were made by the educational travel group through which I take tours with my high school students. So, technically, we were a part of a group of about 25, but we extended our stay and we were actually on our own most of the time we were there. We arrived at around noon and our rooms were ready. My sister and I had paid extra to have single rooms (we like our privacy at the end of the night!). She was given room 25--it was HUGE! There was a full closet with shelving, two twin beds put together to form a king of sorts, the sink & shower area was separate from the toilet area, there were double French door/windows that opened onto the street below--there was a TV with about 10 channels and a mini-refrigerator. Very nice room. When I arrived at my single room (#62) I was under the roof on the top floor...My bed was a double bed that was smashed up against the wall (the French door/windows could only open about 2 inches!)--there was no where to even put a suitcase. I put my suitcase on top of the fridge, but every time I opened my suitcase, the top would switch the light off. There was no floor space to fit a suitcase. There was a desk and chair, but I could not sit at it unless I moved my suitcase off the refrigerator. My 'closet' was about 18 inches wide---no shelves at all, only a few hangers. My bathroom was all in the same room, but because it was in a corner/slanted/roof room, I could not look into the mirror without leaning to my right! It was a very strange set up. I will say that the shower was larger than others that I have had in Paris, and it had GREAT water pressure and it was hot. I did try to change to a different room, but since we had a group there along with the other guests, this was not possible. I did finally change with one of the guides from our group to room #32. It was 3 floors directly below 62, but there was no slanted ceiling to deal with so it seemed a bit larger. Both 32 and 62 faced the interior courtyard of the school nextdoor & the Montparnasse Tower--not the street. The lobby area is very neat, but as a previous poster mentioned, the 'sweet smelling lobby' is actually an incense maching that pumps incense into the air. Some people may like it, but I actually found it to be unpleasant. I am not a big incense person. Anyone with asthma may even have difficulty breathing in the lobby. The desk people were pleasant, we had no problems with them whatsoever. The Internet service is free in the lobby area. We used this every day to communicate with our families. We also ate breakfast every day. It was a very typical French breakfast--crosissants, pain au chocolat, rolls, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, some deli meats, coffee, tea, juice. The breakfast was included in our price. The hotel is less than a 3-5 minute walk to either the Vavin or Raspail metro stops. This was great. There is a market that sets up around the corner on Edgar Quinet--they had very fresh food and other miscellaneous items there. The Montparnasse cemetery is right around the corner as well. The hotel is still doing renovations. There was plastic taped to the floor in the stairwell and on the landings near the elevator. I can see why they would do renovations since the light & airy voilet/purple color scheme of the lobby/rez-de-chaussee area is a drastic contrast with the colors of the rooms (brown, orange,yellow wallpaper--very depressing--see my photos!) January is definitely the closest to an off-season when that type of work would be done. It did not bother me. In all, the hotel was fine. We were not there for long each day anyway. I have actually stayed DIRECTLY across the street at the Mercure Raspail Montparnasse (review was posted in 2009). That hotel was, on a whole, a bit better than the Royal. When I stay in Paris again, I will not stay at the Royal--I would certainly choose the Hotel Saint Jacques (also reviewed in April/May 2009), even though it is a 2 star, the upgraded rooms were nicer. If you already have reservations here, I would ask for a room that faces the street--they seemed to be bigger--at least my sister's room was! Bon voyage--you will have a great time. LAST NOTE: If taking the RER line B to the airport--be sure to check for problems on the line--we were left stranded in a town named Aulnay-sous-bois along with several hundred other travelers trying to catch flights. One Frenchman told us that this does occasionally happen. It was a chaotic situation trying to get one of the few taxis from Aulany to Charles de Gaulle. Next time, I would take a taxi from central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Merci; we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: LCubano
Reviews.Content: We selected this review based on a package price, reviews and location. Our daughter scouted a month earlier and enjoyed everything about the accomodations. My wife and I arrived and were quite happy with the reception we received and the atmosphere at Le Royal. I will not tell you that I have stayed in hundreds of hotels but can tell you I do Quality Management for a major hospital enterprise. Our package price was unbeatable and we opted to upgrade our accomodation to Le Royal based on it's location. The breakfast buffet was superb, the wait staff was always very pleasant and courteous and together made for a great start to another day in Paris. Coming home after very long walking days, we were always warmly welcome and our room was perfect. We would return to this location for all of the aforementioned reasons and then some...merci!

Reviews.Title: “I'm a tollerant traveller but AVOID this one!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KittyKittybangbang
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels, but if you are going to Paris, you can do MUCH BETTER THAN THE Hotel Le Royal HONESTLY! I have now come back to read the reviews, and I think they are canned responses and not legit.....its a load of tosh!. Once you move beyond the sweet smelling lobby and the candy filled welcome bowl...its downhill. We were met with two quasi grumpy desk attendants that offered very little in the way of suggestions or places that we could eat, they just pointed to the road a few blocks over and said you'll find something there. The one concierge actually tisked when I said I had a budget of 60 euros to eat dinner for myself and my 10 year old daughter....like we wouldn't be fed at McDonalds on that (which I found somewhat amusing)....we dined on the best steak ever and still came home with change. Now to the rooms, the hotel was under construction so hallways were covered in paint and plastic which is ok, I'm not sleeping in the hallways....its when we got to the rooms, which were dated,....the curtains were hanging off rod, the bed was covered in sheets and blankets, (no duvet) the wall paper was peeling and been reglued, fittings in bathroom dangling from ceiling, the free wi-fi never connected or worked, (might only work in lobby)..and I'm sure we had one of the better rooms. One the other patrons was at the reception asking if he could have another room because his shower was on one side of room and his toilet was on the other...the exasperated receptionist who never cracked a smile for me said....but this is French! I think when you work for a place where patrons aren't happy, it makes you a defensive put upon employee. Our room overlooked the glass topped breakfast area and I don't think there were many takers at 12 euros per person, you could eat next door at the Broc and have a big hot breakfast in a quirky but pleasant atmospher with fresh out of the oven croissants, french bread, freash sqeezed orange juice, a hot drink and fried eggs for 10euros. The positives, it was in a decent location, lots of shops down the Rue du Renne, and mostly Parisians so you know you are getting a bargain, and lots of restaurants a block away on Rue Montparnasse...and lots of movie theatres if you want to see a flick in English after your dinner. I would rate this hotel at the most a 2 star, but I reiterate for 120 euros a night without breakfast, you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming...”
Reviews.Author: Parisselect
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel! The location is fantastic, all sorts of lovely places just about two steps away! The people at the reception desk were very friendly, as were the cleaners. I did not have breakfast in the hotel as there are so many wonderful cafes around there. The Jardin de Luxembourg is just around the corner, as are loads of lovely shops, restaurants and cafes. Le Select became quiet my local. I loved the cleanliness of the rooms too, as previously in Paris I had not been so lucky on that account. Liked as well how easy this hotel was to get to from the Gare du Nord. Am saving up frantically to return as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TeeJayGee74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Royal Hotel in Montparnasse for 4 nights in late September after booking online after reading some reviews on this site. We landed at Orly airport and had to catch a bus to Montparnasse, which cost 8 euro each. Sadly the bus ride took longer than anticipated due to protest marches through Paris, so the trip took about an hour, usually though, we were told, it takes 30 minutes. We had to then walk about 3 blocks to the hotel because as we later found out, most maps in Paris are not to scale!!!! The hotel was very nice. The manager was fantastic upon our arrival (and throughout our stay), giving us information on where and how to travel through the busy Parisien streets. The hotel room was very nice, but small, although apparently, by Paris standards it was about average. The room itself was extremely quiet and peaceful. The hotel was also very quiet and peaceful, which was appreciated after a day of sightseeing around Paris. The buffet breakfast costs 11 euro extra per person/per day, its a little bit pricey for what you get, its basically a continental brekkie, but it is all you can eat, so my advice, is to eat up!!! Wonderful restaurants around the corner in Montparnasse Boulevard. The hop on, hop off bus departs a block up the road on Raspail Boulevard, which is very handy. Directly across the road from the hotel there is a bus which will take you directly into the heart of Paris, again, very handy. Free wifi in the rooms is a huge bonus, although at times it can be a bit slow. For the price, I would recommend a stay here, it is money well spent!!

Reviews.Title: “I would definately go back here and recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: AtmNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: A very clean and well organised small hotel. Standard room was compact but clean, nice ensuite, aircon, great blackout blinds and one of the best beds that I have slept in! Fronting a quiet road, adjacent to a really great busy area full of cafes and restaurants. So easy to get to from Charles De gaulle airport, train straight to Port Royal and then a 5 minute walk. Two metro stops are also close by, easy access to the City and Eiffle Tower. Continental breakfast was really lovely, you can eat as much as you want, staff also very helpful. Free wi fi and internet use, Flat screen Tv etc. All I have to do is save up for returning to it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsFussbags
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night here sadly, as I thought this hotel was great. I booked a freebie with airmiles so fully expected to be in a tiny room over looking the bins... but our room was big and front facing. Very clean, nicely decorated. Polite and helpful staff. Our room was quiet, no complaints there. Breakfast was perfectly reasonable for me, but if you are looking for a belly busting english or with masses of choice then you might be a bit disappointed. However top marks for serving on white china (not those dreadful mugs) and the room was very clean and well presented. There are lots of cafes within a tiny distance from the hotel so you wont have to go far if you are pooped after a day sightseeing. Very near Metro for all the sights. I thought the area was fine, we did not feel uncomfortable walking back from the metro at about ten thirty pm. Free wi fii (ask at desk for your code) which had my other half jumping around like he had frogs legs with his iPhone... he could get the football results which kept him quiet while I had a bath. Sadly though, now most frenchmen call me "madame". No longer am I "madamoiselle", which was my only complaint about the trip!!! Good little hotel says madame le Sac de fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Good Base. Not Always Quiet Though.”
Reviews.Author: trev1uk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Royal is a small hotel but is in a good location for exploring without paying ridiculous prices elsewhere. The staff are generally friendly and helpful. I'd booked a single room, which was small even on that basis, but it was definately clean and the bed was comfortable. The in-room TV picture reception was quite poor. The first night, those in neighbouring rooms were noisy, and on another it seemed that - at 2am - a member of the hotel staff was going round all the empty rooms and checking them - with each door slamming shut as they went. The hotel offers a small selection at breakfast - continental buffet with juice and coffee - and you can have free coffee throughout the day. The hotel also offers free use of the single computer as well as free wifi - although there connection problems with both when I stayed. Out and about, you're not far from anything:- metro, restaurants, the usual sights and attractions, shops, bars, grocers and markets. All in all, this hotel offers quite good value given its location, and it is clean, tidy and comfortable. If you can live with the occassional late night noise, it offers a good base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin. - A no frills hotel which serves as an excellent base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Albyn66
Reviews.Content: Location: Based in Montparnasse near three metros, giving easy access all parts of Paris. Around the hotel are several reasonable bars and bistros. (Though to be honest, better ones are found a short metro trip away in St Germain). Down some of the smaller streets are also some nice boutique type shops. Jardin du Luxembourg is also a short walk away. Getting there: We found this hotel easy to reach, a simple train ride on the RER from the airport (CDG) to Port Royal and a 5 min walk to the hotel. The Hotel itself was very comfortable and clean. We had a junior suite so the room was spacious The Staff were also very helpful. They dealt with all enquiries in an efficient manor, especially with checking in online for the journey home.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ahlavenka
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. It was clean, neat, air conditioned and rather a good size for Europe. Stay in the twin bed rooms which have been updated - the double room which I caught a glimpse of are much smaller. It was in a good and safe neighborhood which we walked around until late in the evening. There are multiple cafes, restaurants and bistros right around the corner with such great choices. It is about a hundred feet away from two metro stations ( you will be at any of the attractions and sites within 5 - 10 minutes.) Although in a bustling area the rooms were soundproofed and we could not hear any noise coming from the street. Staff was wonderful and helpful. Breakfast was a good way to start the day. If I ever go back to Paris I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Paris/Montparnasse without comprimising quality”
Reviews.Author: odziggel
Reviews.Content: I spent around 4-5 hours on trip advisor looking for a hotel for 2 nights for a weekend trip to Paris. In the areas we were looking at (Montparnasse/St Germain/Quartier Latin) this hotel definitely represented the best value-for-money BY FAR (around 1/2 the price of equivalent hotels) without wanting to sacrifice the quality and comfort of Western-style accommodation, and did not disappoint. The location was fantastic (50 yards from the nearest metro station; a no-more-than-5 minute walk to a major one with several lines running through it etc) and was conveniently located just off Boulevard Montparnasse, making it easy to find and/or describe where it is. The lobby was air-conditioned, clean, friendly staff, locked at night (with someone at the front-desk to let you in.) There is also a computer for guests' use with free internet access. The receptionist was even kind enough to allow me to use it several hours after we had checked out to book our train tickets home. The room was small - as is to be expected of all hotel rooms in Paris - but very clean, modern, well air-conditioned, mini-bar available, WiFi with a strong signal - everything was covered flawlessly, to the point where you ask yourself what other comparable hotels could possibly be doing to charge twice the rate. The bathroom was the same - small but modern and clean. All in all I was 100% satisfied with our choice of this hotel, and was very relieved that it did not disappoint in any way. This would definitely be my choice of hotel if I were to return to Paris (unless I wanted to try something new just for the sake of staying in a different part of the city etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BossMama
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we have stayed in Le Royal booked for us by an on line travel service. Our room was small but that isn't unusual in Paris. The bathroom was very clean and new. We had a shower only. The beds were comfortable. New windows totally shut out street noise. The air conditioning worked well. The staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was adequate. The hotel location is really great-very close to two Metro stations and wonderful restaurants. All in all, a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but spotlessly clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: andrewbLondon
Reviews.Content: The room was very small - bathroom had a shower, no bath. Rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard, staff were very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make your stay pleasant. Coffee is available at all times, but breakfast was additional cost but I didn't have any so can't comment. Free wifi was extremely convenient as well as computer in the lobby. Lobby also has very comfy chairs and sofas for visitors. Not cheap, but by paris standards a great price for a 3* hotel. Lots of restaurants in the area and metro is extremely closeby. All in all a clean, friendly place to stay but not overly luxurious or romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel at a great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Momplustwo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of an Air France Holidays vacation (after checking TripAdvisor, of course!). We had a triple room (hard to find in Paris). The hotel was clean, quiet, comfortable and well-located in a quiet residential neighborhood of the 14th Arondissement. It has a courteous English-speaking desk staff. Two short blocks away is busy Montparnasse Blvd. with many restaurants and shops. There two Metro stations within two blocks. The breakfast room was bright and airy, with good food and friendly fellow travelers. The only drawback (?) was a tiny elevator, to be expected for a European city hotel in a stately older building. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Petew00dy
Reviews.Content: We were having a weekend break and making use of Air Miles discount. Whether this was the reason we were given such a pokey little room on the top floor I wouldn't know, but the shower head locator was broken, so it had to be hand-held, and the direction valve was also broken, so one couldn't have a bath instead as water only went to the shower. The problem was promptly reported, but nothing could be done and no change to a better room was offered. A pity, as the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with personal touch”
Reviews.Author: LadyMayor
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Rooms comfortable - very modern. Fine breakfast - Small hotel with owner often behind the desk assuring everything is going well for the travelor. The whole place decorated beautifully. Personal assistance given would be tough to beat. My mother needed ice for her failing knees, and they set her up with great care. Our return flight to London was cancelled due to Brit Airway strike and owner (Akim?) helped me through the process of rebooking and even set us up with another couple to share expense of an hour ride to airport. He would NOT accept a tip!!! Only asked that we take care of his employees instead. Location was fantastic- Only need to stroll a minute or two to find a pleathura of wonderful bistros. And, the Open-Tour bus stops very close to hotel. If you want a specific recommendation, the desk will help, as they will ith other touristy-type questions. Congratulations to the owners for providing fabulous, personal service in a lovely, well maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: trippers253
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel in a fabulous location. Close to the Metro, lots of restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood and an easy walk to a lot of sights. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was a good start to the day, free internet in the lobby was great. Rooms were nicely decorated and well kept, typically European in size. Definately would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic, small hotel in one of the most atmospheric parts of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ex-Buffalonian
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience at Le Royal- starting with the check-in staff member who was sympathetic to my lack of sleep/jet lag upon arrival around 11AM. He proposed a Jr. Suite at a discount, which would be readied as quickly as possible. It was, and what a good room: marble topped sinks, spotless bathtub and shower with gleaming fixtures, large bed, desk table and a number of armchairs and chairs. The room faced the courtyard and was quiet. Excellent buffet-style breakfast, internet terminal available- and best of all, location. The hotel is quite close to the famous Raspail/Montparnasse intersection, cafes like the Dome, Coupole and Select described by Hemingway when he lived in the city, and near the rue de la Grande Chaumiere of artistic history, Gertrude Stein's apartment, and the ever wonderful Luxembourg gardens. One of the nicest areas in Paris, and as other reviewers have noted, very handy to metro lines 4 and 12, and 6 a bit further off. The clientel also makes a difference. No party animals, frat trips, or school groups. A quiet, fairly well off segment of the tourist and business markets, making no waves and appreciating their surroundings. Very clean, wonderful lounge downstairs, and literally a few feet down the blvd. Raspail, toward the blvd. Montp[arnasse, an excellent Italian restaurant as well as a more traditional cafe and another equally good small, boutique type restaurant. Memorable experiences in all three; the cafe perfect for just a hot chocolate/sandwich type meal. The old, inexpensive hotels in this area are now almost all gone. Le Royal is a perfect replacement starting around 200 Euros per night. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: CarringtonWealth
Reviews.Content: Well-located 3* hotel close (<200m) to Vavin Metro station. We asked for a quiet room as the street is quite busy. We got what we asked for- the only downside being that the quiet rooms at the back of the hotel are smaller than those at the front. The bed was also queen (as opposed to king) sized and far too short for someone of my height (1.9m). Other than that the place was excellent - great shower (no bath), good service, free papers (on the table outside the breakfast room) and internet. We'll definitely go back - may just ask for a larger room next time.

Reviews.Title: “A small clean hotel, ideal for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: gizzmo00
Reviews.Content: Situated in the Montparnasse area with all the bars and restaurants this hotel is small, clean and very quiet. The staff are friendly and helpful. Roomes are typically small as are most in Paris. Free Wifi was a welcome bonus. The breakfast was average and to be honest a little repetative and we had to ask for meats and croissants to be refilled however this was willingly and quickly done. We had a room overlooking Rue Raspail but heard little noise due to good sound insulation. Metro was just around the corner and this gave us easy access to the rest of Paris. Well recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BernalBot
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my 4-night stay at the Hotel Le Royal. The location was convenient to the Metro and was walking distance to cafes, shops and other sites. The staff was friendly and helpful. They took the liberty of upgrading our room was extra special. There was a misplacement of our room key and they gave me a new key, and eventually found the original. The continental breakfast was wonderful and offered quite a variety beyond what you'd find in the U.S. I loved the extra amenities such as the Nespresso coffee machine and free WiFi. The room was a good size, quiet and clean (high points!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: brambling_10
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with charming management - we were greeted by name when we arrived. Our children had a fantastic room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street. Our room was at the back and very quiet. The breakfast was ok and enough to keep us going through the day. The area is great - there's a fantastic bistro (Bistrot des Campagnes) just across the street and along Rue Léopold Robert, and plenty of others within easy walking distance - could have spent a month there just exploring the local eateries. Would I stay there again? Definitely! (I was also present in the lobby when the the previous reviewer's wife was complaining about lack of wi-fi. To be honest I thought she was being unreasonable and, to my mind the management were dealing with this difficult customer with great courtesy.)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but terrible hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: wsdwsd
Reviews.Content: Postives: Good location -- located in a safe area near 2 (Vavin (closest) and Raspail )metro stops, decent European breakfast, free internet (we brought our laptop but had to use it in the lobby as the wireless signal didn't reach our room on the 5th floor). Several good restaurants nearby (Creperie Plougastel at 47 Rue du Monparnasse, Chez Berbert --- good Morrocan restaurant nearby, Coupoule ?sp --very good French cuisine) Negatives: VERY rude and unaccomodating hotel manager. We came for a week to see the sights (1st trip to Paris). On day 5, Sunday AM, we went downstairs to eat breakfast and then returned to our room to get out coats, gloves, hats (it was 32 degrees F outside), my wofe's purse, and our camera. Our electronic door lock would not work. The hotel staff tried repeatedly but it still wouldn't work. They removed the lock cover & tried their master keys to no avail. I asked them to call a locksmith or the manager but they refused. Finally they called the manager who agreed to come in --- by that time we wife convinced them to let her try the master key and she was finally able to open the door and the manager didn't have to come in. I asked to speak to the manager but the desk clerk refused and said I would have to take it up with him the next day. After all this, we had spent 4 hrs in the lobby waiting to get into our room (it was too cold to go out without protection) and finally left the hotel by 1:30 PM. We were upgraded to a somewhat larger room for the last 2 nights of our stay. I asked the manager if he would refund a portion of 1 night's stay as we had wasted 1/2 a day stranded in the hotel lounge (rather than seeing Paris) because we could not get into our room but he was quite rude and flatly refused. Not only did he refuse any other compensation but he was very rude about it. Finally he said " I do not know what to think, I have no mind...." My wife was quite upset at his rudeness. The other hotel staff (especially Sammy the night attentent) was very good but the main hotel manager was unbelievably rude. Considering we lost an entire morning of our trip, we didn't feel a room upgrade for 2 nights was fair, but the manager made it clear he could care less. The rooms are fairly small and the mattresses uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler061
Reviews.Content: This is a good 3 star property. The plusses: Well-located, friendly helpful staff who speak English, clean, modern. The lobby area and breakfast room are especially stylish with modern but comfortable furniture. There is free Wi-fi in the rooms if you bring your laptop. Otherwise there is a free computer near the lobby to connect with the internet. The breakfast was a standard cold buffet with croissants, bread, butter and jelly, meat and cheese, yoghurt, cold cereal, mixed fruit, applesauce, juice, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. I only wish the yoghurt had been flavored rather than plain. Our room was quite comfortable, but laid out in an unusual manner. One entered the room into a hallway, with the bathroom off that hall before getting to the bedroom. Still, it was convenient. The hallway had a hall tree for hanging extra clothes and there was a nice closet with shelves, built into the room. The room was clean and serviced regularly. The negatives: The only English language channel on our TV was CNN, and for some reason that didn’t work after the first day. The heater in the bathroom, designed to heat the towels didn’t work. The shower head had an extra spray out the side rather than in a nice smooth spray. We didn’t complain about any of these issues, because they really didn’t affect our stay and seemed minor. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ericwc
Reviews.Content: We have 2 rooms for 5 persons. 57 is a small room facing the light wall. Cozy but could be a bit boring. 58 is a big room with shower and bath, facing the court yard. Great location, close to everything, lively yet quiet. M4 and M6 stations are few minutes walk. Great food all around. Friendly English speaking staff . Clean rooms. Weather was cold but they bring extra heater. Breakfast is typical continental fare but adequate. Will stay again. Free WiFi. Newspaper.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! I Love Paris, and I Loved this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: donnalmorgan
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris, we were a little nervous not knowing the city or language. I knew that safety, cleanliness and location for picking a hotel were my main concerns. WE LUCKED OUT with Le Royal Hotel!!! The room was CLEAN. The bathroom was CLEAN (cleaner than a lot of American Hotels I've stayed in!). The view was GREAT!! The double door windows that opened up to the beautiful Parisian Street were the absolute BEST thing about the whole room!!! The location was GREAT!!! This hotel is in on a main SAFE street in Paris in the southern end of Paris, one block away from Vavin Metro Station and the Taxi Station and 2 blocks away from the Train. On the corner is an ATM and right around the corner from the ATM is a FABULOUS french bakery we found, they don't speak any English but pointing to all the incredible treats worked very well! This hotel is walking distance from Luxemburg Gardens, Notre Dame Cathedral, the Louvre, and LOTS OF Restaurants and shopping!! We always saw lots of Police on bikes or horses and the streets were clean and well lit so I always felt safe. The continental breakfast at the Hotel was AWESOME!!! We took full advantage of it every morning before heading out for the day --- there was a full dining room type area for breakfast which included a selection of breads, jams, fresh meats and cheeses, eggs, yogurt, fruit salad, cereal, coffee, tea etc YUM!!! The lobby had a pc with free internet service and a coffee machine with free coffee 24/7. The staff was SUPER GREAT, someone was always there 24/7 to help with any questions, they could book just about anything you were interested in (boat river dinner cruise and moulin rouge are 2 musts!), give you specific directions to anywhere you wanted to go and always had tips for the best way to get around Paris depending on the destination and time of day, day of the week. I loved Paris so much I never wanted to leave!!! The food, the wine, the champagne, the sights, the shopping, the SHOES!!! :-) I've attached some pictures of the room we stayed in and the view from the room to this review, feel free to contact me if you are looking for more info!

Reviews.Title: “amazing little hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jokam
Reviews.Content: This lovely, friendly little boutique hotel was in a perfect position for the Left Bank. We were in the heart of the cafe and shopping districto f Montparnasse, and walked to every major landmark in Paris. The staff were so friendly, and the breakfast was delicious. I would be hard=pressed to chooses a different hotel if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: penny87
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every aspect ,staff outstandly effcient and friend. Noting was too much trouble.I am a wheelchair user and the help I received could not have been better. Thank you Jean Clifton

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself a Favor......”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifecanada
Reviews.Content: Paris, France Hotel Le Royal....14th Arron. My third trip to Paris, my husband's first.Spent 7 nights at this hotel. Location: On Raspail Blvd., a lovely, quiet street in a mainly residential neighborhood. Located between two metro stations- Raspail and Vavin.Easy access. Many restaurants within close proximity.Close also to Luxembourg Gardens. Hotel: Small-48 rooms (chosen for this reason).Front desk staff pleasant, helpful and very kind. Room: clean(as is entire hotel),electronic safe in closet,mini bar (stocked), maid service efficient. Breakfast: included in our rate was buffet and of excellent quality - juices,cold meats,cheeses,fruit,yogourt,cereals,toast, melt-in-your-mouth croissants, tea, and wonderful cafe au lait. As a couple celebrating thirty-five years of marriage, we saw and did everything we had set out to see and do on this vacation. We literally had The Time of Our Lives. Staying at Le Royal was terrific for us and we highly recommend. Conclusion: See Paris with someone you love and stay here. You will make wonderful memories--I guarantee it.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE OF HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Wipeout33
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good bathroom, full size bath with powerful shower, good hairdryer, safe and TV. Very good location, close to Bars, Cafes, Resturants and 3 Metro Stations.Stayed 3 nights with no complaints. Breakfast was typical meats, cheeses, croissants, fruit juice, yoghurts, eggs, tea & coffee in very pleasant surroundings. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Staff were very helpful with keeping our luggage after checkout time as our flight was early evening, we had the lounge & toilet facilities to change which was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_Voyageur
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were very helpful—even the guy who kept trying to sell us boat trips on the Seine. The a/c actually worked, which is more than one can say for many other Parisian hotels (the lobby of the Holiday Inn near the Jardin du Luxembourg, for example, was a sauna). The rooms were very clean and elegantly appointed, and the bathrooms were full size and comfortable. As for the location, it was perfect. Just a few blocks from the Luxembourg gardens, a couple blocks from the Tour Montparnasse (be sure to go up on top for the view) and mere steps off Boulevard Montparnasse. If you stay here, check out the Italian restaurant next door. Free wireless is available, but slow and you need to ask for more (it's given out in doses of two or five hours at a time for some unfathomable reason). The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. We'd stay there again. The only downside: no hot breakfast (but the coffee and croissants in the breakfast room were superb).

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Arly1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week stay at Le Royal. We are a family of four with two little girls and we had two separate rooms. One located looking over Raspail and one located in the back. Both rooms were equally sized and equally quite. It was a very quite and pleasant hotel. Location is GREAT! Located on metro Vavin line 4 and Raspail line 6. With these two lines, we had quick and easy metro access to anywhere in the city. Montparnasse Tower is a 10 minute walk away. Luxemburg Garden is a 5 minute walk away. Breakfast was great. As one review already mentioned, the breakfast was the same everyday. Fresh fruit salad, boiled eggs, a selection of deli and sweet breads. We found ALL of the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. They were quick to help with anything we needed. Lots of restaurants to choose from. One to stay away from "Le Petite Broc" just a few doors down - AVOID! Had magots in the ketchup. Waiter thought nothing of it. Italian restaurant next door was great. We had a great two weeks at this hotel and we highly, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beaware of the front desk lady!”
Reviews.Author: JS-Toronto-Ontario
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Royal is a great Hotel in Paris, clean room, close to Metro, restaurant & bars, excellent location with excellent value in price. House keeping staff and front desk gentlemen are nice & friendly, EXCEPT the morning shift front desk lady ( You know who I speak to, thank you! ), she is not friendly, not helpful and not hospitality professional, period. Please watch out, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PBspecial
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in early July 2009. I needed a hotel that had a triple room because two friends were going to join me on my business trip. I found this hotel nice, in a great location, and reasonably priced. The triple room was quite large with a big bathroom. It overlooks the back of the hotel, off the street, so no road noise with the windows open. My two work colleagues had double rooms (one each). Room 1 was quite small but cute and fine for a single traveller, Room 2 was slightly larger but nothing like the triple. Both are typical for Paris though, and very similar in size to the Holiday Inns and Best Westerns I usually stay at in Paris (been to 4 different ones). The location is great, near Montparnasse and easy walking to St Germain and St Michel. Restaurants nearby are famous for the seafood - La Coupole and Le Dome, well known but both quite pricey. We found a cute Cuban spot on Avenue Vavin just a block away - for a change of pace from French food! And in the winter you must eat at the fondue place across the street - yum! I'd stay again at this place - good value, great location!

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikepar
Reviews.Content: Great location near subways, restaurants,cafes, shops etc. . Rooms were very clean, breakfast was more than adequate and the staff very friendly and approachable. We would stay here again and recommend Le Royal to other travellers. Make sure to check out the open air markets on weekends on Edgar Quinet Blvd, C'est tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: ja2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week. We were extremely happy with our room and the service at this hotel. As others have mentioned, the location is perfect - close to the Metro and in walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Overall, the hotel is very clean and we felt very comfortable staying here. I would have to agree that the walls are quite thin, as this can be very noticeable in a 'romantic' city such as Paris!! All in all, we had a wonderful time in this amazing city and would most defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean Hotel, good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nic1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights recently and was very impressed with the relitively cheap hotel. The staff are very welcoming and the room that we were in was spacious and well equipped. The room had a mini bar in which compared to Paris prices were not that bad, A 250cl beer about 4 euros. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast which was ok. My husbands only complaint was the free Wifi didn't have a very strong signal, so was quite poor, that said there was a computer in the lobby that was free for guests to use. The hotel was also happy to store bags either before or after checking in if your flights did not tally with the times. Nice area too, near lots of restaurants and bars, and the metro!!

Reviews.Title: “Facile PARIS”
Reviews.Author: paulyMaine
Reviews.Content: Based on location,proximity to transportation and restaurants ,cleanliness and sincerety of the staff,Le Royal Montparnasse is an excellent choice for a week in Paris.The location makes it EASY to get anywhere in the city.Many fun restaurants(La Coupole,Dome,Select,Timbre and others) are nearby for dining or just watching the world go bye.Ask Michel at the desk for his restaurant list-handwritten with care and well researched. It`s a short stroll to the Luxembourg and the Latin Quarter With the savings over the cost of hotel accomodations in the 5th you can stay longer or eat better.Bonne chance!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aroxen
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean rooms and bathrooms, free Internet Service, helpful staff, close to metro stop, affordable price Cons: Typical shoebox-size european hotel room, small beds, thin walls, Internet speed is slow *Free daily breakfast includes croissants, deli meat, fruit salad, juice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BelsizeM
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in St Germain but this year the strong Euro led us to look further afield and we found a good deal directly with the Hotel Le Royal. We booked a standard double room which was a reasonably good size. The bathroom had plenty of space for us to leave our stuff and had a bath with a shower screen. Overall we were delighted with the room which was very quiet despite overlooking the main road. The location was great; a lively district with an excellent saturday morning market nearby and within walking distance of St Germain. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, location and value.”
Reviews.Author: susaninmesa
Reviews.Content: Our 7 night stay was very pleasant. We booked our trip through Virgin Vacations and this hotel was one of the choices. We selected Le Royal based on $$$ value as compared to a central Paris hotel and research based on other reviews and mapping out metro stops and walking distances. The staff was always very pleasant and helpful with directions and a re-booking of a tour. At the end of long days of walking and sightseeing we were very happy to find our room freshly cleaned and vacuumed. Our room was a Jr. Suite (sleeping for three) that looked onto a school play yard at the rear of the building, no street noise! The bath area featured two lavatories and separate tub and shower with compartmentalized WC - very nice for the three of us! The hairdryer had a 110 outlet but be advised that it did not accept US plugs with the wide flange. The continental breakfast featured fresh baked goods, meats, fruits, coffee, tea and orange juice. There are many places to eat in the area, especially seafood (poissons). We also found a couple of Italian restaurants, a steak house, asian foods and street crepes (mmm-mmmm) within walking distance. There is a coin laundry around the block (Lav-club - but I understand this can be $$$ and time consuming). We caught a train to Versailles out of Gare Montparnasse, a 10 minute walk away. For shopping there is a Galleries Lafayette as well as great window shopping along Blvd Raspail. The nearby Vavin metro station (line 4) can get you to the Louvre area by changing routes at Chatelet (line 1). On our last night we went to the top of the tour Montparnasse for a view of the city lights and to watch the Tour Eiffel light show. Our second floor room was neatly maintained, warm for the cold nights and did not smell of smoke. The internet at the hotel is frustrating to use. At times it was okay for surfing, but sending messages was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFoodFan
Reviews.Content: The Paris - Le Royal Montparnasse Hotel is a very good value. We had one double room and one single room. The double room was spacious for a Paris Hotel, but the single room was typically small. The hotel was reasonably quiet. The beds and the bed linens were comfortable. The breakfasts were quite good and the staff friendly. Liked the free wi-fi, We loved the location in the Montparnasse area, It is near some great restaurants and some sights we had not visited before in our 6 prior trips to Paris. The hotel is also very close to two Metro lines making it very easy to get anywhere in Paris. (Also very easy to get to from CDG via RER) Our only complaint is that it is hard to close the room doors quietly. So when a family with two rooms next to us on our corner arrived at 1:00 am we constantly heard doors slamming from 1:00 am to 1:40 am. Fortunately this was not repeated.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: penfolduk22
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel, very clean rooms a little small but comfortable. Attentive staff very helpful and informative. Superb location close to metro and good selection of nearby restaurants. Strongly recommend the Relais de L'Entrecôte Restaurant newly opened on Montparnase Boulavard. Good basic continental breakfast eat well because Paris is becoming very expensive especially with the weak pound. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the value”
Reviews.Author: eugenefranklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during from the 26th of Dec to Jan.1, 2009 on a go-today package. It included breakfast which was nice but make sure to get there early to get more variety. As for the service, ask for Michel who was absolutely the best at giving quality service and time. Celine was also nice. Alexander worked there one of the nights we were there and he was not helpful at all. Actually he was bothered if you asked him anything. The hotel was remodeled and therefore looked nice however, the remodeled room we got was smelled very smoky and it was "non-smoking". I think that's why they housekeeping would crack the window open after cleaning the room. However, in december it was very cold so we didn't think that was a good idea. The room was small but this is expected in Europe,however it seemed as if the rooms with twin beds were bigger. Plenty of places to eat on this street. Overall this place was adequate but not sure if I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: buildingmemories
Reviews.Content: I booked our New Year's vacation in Paris through Go-today.com, and used Trip Advisor's members' comments to determine which of the hotels offered I would choose. I made a good decision when choosing Le Royal. It is a small, intimate hotel, clean, comfortable and tastefully decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is by no means, however, a luxury hotel, if that is what you are looking for. I traveled to Paris with my husband and my adult son, who is fluent in French and familiar with Paris. We had a triple room on the 5th floor which was surprisingly spacious. My son had his own twin bed in a somewhat separated section of the room, and my husband and I had a king sized bed (two twins put together) that was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and designed well for three people, with a tub and shower, a separate walk in shower, double sinks, and a toilet that was separated from the rest of the bathroom. We were in the back part of the building, and all in all it was very quiet. The maid cleaned well each day and shampoo and soap were provided. Bring your own hair conditioner and body lotion, as these were not provided. Our plan included the breakfast. The food was the same everyday, but it was good and nutrious--all you can eat boiled eggs, cheese, juice, milk, coffee, tea, sliced ham, fruit salad, cereal, croissants, pain au chocolat, etc.. Breakfast is served between 6 and 10:30. We filled up on breakfast and didn't have to eat again until dinner. While it may be expensive if not included in your plan, it beats walking around Paris in the winter weather looking for a place to eat first thing in the morning. Beware of the phone service. A phone is in each room. I made some collect calls, and my son was using a prepaidphone card he purchased for international calls, but for some reason the hotel still charges for the calls when you use the phone. We were very upset to find a $39 bill tacked on to our final bill for what we thought were free calls, and more upset that we were not warned of this. There wasn't a good explanation as to how the charges were figured. The location of the hotel is fantastic. The hotel is less than two blocks from the Vivan metro stop and within easy walking distance to Tour Montparnasse and the nearby Galleria Lafayette and other shops. Plus there are lots of restaurants and small wine, pastry and other shops around. I was very happy with the location. The building is now equipped with internet service. If you don't bring your own computer, there is a computer in the lounge. You are given 30 minutes without charge and are assigned a password. I'm not sure what the price is after that. If you bring your own computer, however, you are given free blocks of time to use in your room. While it appears that you are limited to 5 hours, that is actually not the case and you can ask for more time if need be. All in all this was a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wishi was still there...”
Reviews.Author: Red_skys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September and was very pleased with this hotel,. The staff were helpful, friendly and spoke good English. The reception is bright and inviting and the hotel is about 5 minutes from the metro. The rooms are conformable, nicely decorated and very clean. They are however Very small, but this is not unusual for Paris, The size of the rooms may be a bigger issue for those customers who are of a large frame but wont bother most, after all your in Paris how long will you stay in you room!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased Overall - Just A Few Flaws”
Reviews.Author: bookwoman11
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed 5 nights as part of a GoToday.com package. We knew what to expect, having read the reviews here at TA, and can now say from experience that they're mostly accurate. The location is wonderful; quiet, yet right around the corner from the heart of Montparnasse and directly between two Metro stops, each mere steps away. Also, the Le Tour hop on hop off bus has a stop virtually across the street. The staff was incredible. The much talked about front desk clerk on nights did ask a couple of times if we needed info about tours, but we politely said no thanks and he did not push it. They looked up directions for us, woke us up, made dinner recommendations, and had a cab waiting to take us to the airport, always with a smile on their face. We found the daily breakfast to be perfect for us. The women who served breakfast were not proficient in English, but were very kind and we managed to communicate via sign language when we needed something. Our room, #53, had french doors that opened out to a balcony overlooking the street, and surprisingly, we only had to wait about 15 minutes for it to be ready when we arrived from the airport at about 10:30 in the morning. The only complaint I really have with the hotel is the odor of smoke which permeated our room, despite it being a non-smoking hotel. We aired it out each evening when we returned from our ramblings by opening the french doors, but it is my guess that when a building is that old, all those decades of smoke are hard to get rid of. When we walked into the lobby each evening, that air-freshener scent that other reviewers have mentioned was present and it was sllightly unpleasant. We went straight up the tiny lift to our room though, so it wasn't much of an issue. Also, the first night, I asked for 2 additional pillows and it took 3 days to get them. No big deal for me, but it may be for some.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant and enjoyable stay - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LanceScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night break. Great area. Wanted to stay in 6th district but this is so close to it (a couple of streets away) it was ideal. Great area, good bistros/restaurants/cafes around. Near to bakers too which we used for breakfasts instead of hotel breakfast (if you want to watch your money). Very close to metros and RER. Hotel staff very helpful and accommodating wherever they could - we were staying with family and managed to get 3 rooms on the front which we liked as we could watch the world go by. All our rooms were good - good size especially for Paris and nice bathrooms. They also had AC although we didn't need it as it was a bit cooler when we stayed. Lift is small but in my experience that is the norm for small hotels and did not cause any problems at all. This hotel was a little more expensive than we'd have usually gone for but it was good and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gem056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Le Royal with our son who is 2. We booked it through Airmiles. We booked a double room as it didn't give any other option on the Airmiles website. When we arrived the lady on reception said we hadn't booked a cot and wasn't sure there would be one. She then gave us our key and said she would try and sort something. A few minutes later someone came with a travel cot. He couldn't put it up so he went away and came with another cot which was lovely. My son was very pleased and slept all night which was amazing!! The room was very spacious, clean and with a seperate shower and bath it had everything you could need. The breakfast is also very nice and the coffee and croissants are lovely. The hotel is situated close to Vavin and Raspail metro stations which is easy to use. It is also close to the bus stop for the L'open tour hop on hop off tour bus which I would also recommend. Overall we really enjoyed our 2 nights in Paris at The Hotel Le Royal. We wouldn't stay for any longer though as Paris is far too expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ponylady49
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews for this hotel I thought I was going to be in for a disappointment - surely no hotel could have such consistently good reviews? However, when I got there the place certainly lived up to all the good comments. Including the warning about the night porter selling trips! :) Stayed with husband and 14 year old son - not much to add that hasn't been said before. Great location, very helpful staff, comfortable room. Eating out in Montparnasse was good but expensive - we had our best (and cheapest) meals in Montmatre, so if you're on a budget would advise you go the other side of town to eat. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “MIchel is the best!”
Reviews.Author: Marcie61
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel. The staff were friendly, hardworking and helpful. Thanks Michel for all your help! The hotel was clean and tastefully decorated. Our room was quiet and the shower was wonderful. Lots of good places to eat in the vicinity. Monoprix and the Galeries Lafayette were 10-15 minutes away. La Boutique de L'Artisant Monastique is a cool place where they sell stuff made by monks and nuns. The entrance is a hole in the wall of the Hopital Saint Vincent de Paul. The Vavin Metro station made access to other parts of the city a breeze. Starting the day with a hearty breakfast and coming back to our comfortable little hotel after a long day of shopping and sightseeing was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Croydonguys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a short break to Paris. It is located less than 5 minutes walk from Vavin Metro. If arriving from CDG or Orly airports you can take the RER to Denfert-Rochereau station and either walk 10-15 minutes to the hotel or take the Metro to Vavin (CDG to Denfert is about a 40 minute journey). The hotel staff speak English and were very helpful. There is a lobby with internet access (if you pay!), a lift and breakfast room - but no restuarant or bar. Our room (no. 12) was on the first floor and had a double bed and a small en-suite toilette, basin & shower. The airconditioned bedroom itself was a little small and the main problem was a lack of drawers for clothing - we had to use the desk drawers! The decor was modern, the room clean & the bed comfortable. The continental buffet breakfast was sufficient to start the day. Near the hotel there are cafes and bistro. Using Metro line 4 from Vavin you can easily access the Latin Quarter, Ile de la Cite, Gare du Nord and even Sacre Coeur. The Jardin du Luxembourg, St Germain-des-Pres and the Latin Quarter are within walking distance if you do not mind stretching your legs! The Montparnasse Tower is just around the corner and gives fantastic views of Paris by day and night...without the horrendous queues you get at the Eiffel Tower. In short...good value and handy location - I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Received royal treatment at Hotel Le Royal”
Reviews.Author: thepiequeen
Reviews.Content: Arriving at Hotel Le Royal after flying overnight from the U.S. was delightful. The exterior of the hotel is well maintained. Stepping in to the lobby, it was obvious that daily care is taken with the appearance and cleanliness of the entire hotel. The front desk staff were gracious, kind, friendly, and beyond helpful during our stay. They provided accurate directions, made restaurant reservations, and were patient with all our questions. Our room was in the rear of the hotel on the 4th floor. Our large window opened! The room itself was compact yet not crowded and contained everything needed for our stay - bed with padded leather headboard, nightstands, armoire, desk & chair, mini-fridge, and though not needed, a flat screen television. The decor was tasteful and understated, which we found very restful. Our private bath was a comfortable size and while the shower was different from our experience at home, it was adequate. Loved the tub and took advantage of several long soaks! The bed was comfortable and cozy and we slept extremely well. Breakfast is served in a dining room down a short hallway from the front desk. Half of the dining room is under a glass ceiling - so cheerful especially on overcast or rainy days.
