The buffet offers many choices including but not limited to fresh croissants, beignets, baguette, ham, boiled eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juices, and cheese. The room is attractive, the furniture comfortable, and like the rest of the hotel, everything is attended to and clean. The staff refill food and drinks on the buffet when empty or low. The staff also quickly clear and clean tables for other guests. How wonderful that the breakfast buffet is available until 10:30am!!! I mistakenly left my prescription reading glasses in the hotel room when we checked out and I was back in the U.S. before I realized it. I emailed the hotel, received a response the next day, and my glasses were returned to me (at my expense - appropriately). Merci, Michel and Narema! We hated to leave Hotel Le Royal. While it's tempting to check out another hotel when we return to Paris, we won't risk it. We'll go back to Hotel Le Royal! For anyone wondering, my husband and I each speak very, very minimal French. We experienced throughout Paris, not just at Hotel Le Royal, kindness and a willingness to help, even when communication due to language differences was challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lovelouisa_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 day break at the Royal Montparnasse. When we arrived we were given a room with no window or daylight. I complained to the very helpful receptionist and was immediately given another room which was perfect. It looked out onto a school and had good views of the Montparnasse Tower. The hotel is simple but well furnished, clean and very comfortable. The location is excellent with Metro station Vavin just across the road. The station is on a direct line from Gare du Nord line 4, which is very useful if you are arriving by Eurostar. Definitely recommended but don't accept the 'darkroom.'

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MariCanari
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay in Paris at Hotel Le Royal. It was a very nice and charming hotel in a very central location, easily accessible by the metro. There are also numerous restaurants on Montparnasse blvd which is its main intersection. We criss-crossed Paris every day to see the sights and easily used the metro every day. The staff were helpful and friendly and also spoke excellent English. While our room was small in North American standards, we adjusted to it and found it comfortable as we were really only using the hotel as a place to sleep! Our breakfast was included in our package and it was quite good - croissants, fresh coffee, juice, pains au chocolat, fruit. Overall, I would definitely reccommend this hotel for the budget conscious traveller looking for a friendly and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: piggytailchick
Reviews.Content: We travelled on Eurostar to Paris - Gare Nord, and got the metro to Le Royal, (Really easy, Line 4 and jump off at Vavin should take about 20/25mins). Hotel is about 1 minute walk (if that) from metro but as the paths are tree lined, you cannot not see it from the metro exit…. Look out for the large (and impressive) seafood restaurant on corner it is very close/about opposite to that!!! Check-in very swift, room a fair size, and very clean with quite dark décor but contemporary. Excellent double glazing, the street was quite busy in morning, but you could hardly hear it at night and we were on the front of the hotel. Floors a bit squeaky and the doors to the guest’s rooms shut with rather a thump, but not a problem…. Breakfast good and served til 10.30am ….. croissants, fresh baguettes, honey jam, lovely fruit salad, coffee, and juice, really simple but plentiful! Overall really pleased with hotel and location, I would recommend this to friends and stay there if we visited Paris in the future! Do wander round the Jardin de Luxembourg (Large gardens very close to hotel) it is very beautiful and have a drink in the news café on corner...very relaxing!) One warning …..the food and drinks in Paris are very expensive…… (especially with the poor exchange rate at the moment!!)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: IdahoCajun
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a "last minute" site after discovering the dear husband hadn't made hotel reservations for our 3 day stay over in Paris. Our hotel had to be fairly centrally located and sleep 3 people (ok, 2 adults and a 6 foot tall 17 year old). What a wonderful surprise this turned out to be. Fabulous room with plenty of space for the 3 of us, gorgeous decor, comfortable single beds for all (though a bit short if you're 6 feet tall). Desk clerks all spoke English and were quite friendly and very helpful. Wonderful area of Paris, very attractive street, great cafes and restaurants nearby, 3 blocks from Luxembourg Gardens, right on 2 Metro lines. Couldn't have been a better experience (unless somebody else paid, I guess!)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SheltonElizabeth52
Reviews.Content: First of all this is a beautiful hotel, clean and modern, but with Parisian flare of the wrought iron, floor to ceiling windows, etc. It overlooks a parklike setting with trees and pigeons. There are also shops close by for whatever you may need.The rooms have flat screen TV, internet capabilities, safe, WC separate from the shower and sink. The rooms are beautifully appointed as is the lobby and the breakfast room. Breakfast can be cold or hot with fruits, coissants, toast, cereal, coffee, tea, yogart, milk, juice. The breakfast has something for everyone. I cannot say enough about the staff, in particular Michel and Candrou. They showed us on maps how to use the Metro (which is simple and wonderful). They recommended restaurants and made reservations. In general they made us feel welcome and well taken care of. I would welcome them in my home. I cannot say enough about how wonderful and helpful they were. I hope to come back to Paris one day and I will stay at Le Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Hotel Le Royal”
Reviews.Author: Kwasibo
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Paris an this enhanced by an excellent staty at the Hotel Le Royal in Paris. The location was excellent. It was easy to find and a couple of minutes from two metro stations. Also it is on the CityTours bus route and hence makes taking the tour and seeing the sights easy. The staff were excellent and always willing to help as well as informative. The breakfast was continental and adequate. The room was contempary but homely and the shower very clean. For a 3* the general standard was excellent. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: Friesh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Le Royal, a fabulous little hotel on the second longest street in Paris. It was clean, well kept. Even though we spoke a little French, the desk clerks all spoke English. The desk clerks were all courteous and helpful. Our stay included a continental breakfast every morning which was always fresh and delicious. The room we had was small but very comfortable. The bathroom facilities were modern and clean. We had a fantastic time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: kaaFw
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with a nice location. Very comfortable. Very safe area, lots of restaurants & cafes nearby. Staff was very helpful with my poor French. We had problems, though, with one night clerk, who tried to sign us up for anything he could. We could hardly pass by him without him touting something that would make him some money. I would stay here again, but give this guy a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for us in 5 Paris trips”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Royal for 6 nights on a Go-Today.com package. Wonderful hotel—clean with a modern décor. Our best stay after 3 Go-Today Paris packages and 5 total trips. Excellent neighborhood and within one block of 2 Metro stops (Vavin and Raspail). The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The breakfast included pastries, bread, cheese, ham, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, fruit salad, apple sauce, juice and tea/coffee/hot chocolate. Our room (#47) was a little larger than usual. The bed was comfortable; the bath spacious. Our window overlooked an air shaft, but it was quiet! The lighting could have been brighter, but my only real complaint was that the elevator was broken—we had to climb 4 floors to our room. But it helped me burn more calories! Will stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: sallygal
Reviews.Content: I go to Paris often and booked this hotel through Venere.com for a long weekend, last minute , trip with my fiance. I lived in this area once (14th) , so knew it would be a good area for a short stay. The hotel is nicely located, with easy access to all of Paris, the train station Montparnasse and so easy in and out via metro to the airport. The hotel was okay. The room was really small, even by Paris 3 star standards, but the rooms had recently been redone and the bathroom was very small but nice. The bed seemed older, however, and was not comfortable. Our room was somewhat noisy being located next to the maid's supply room (lots of traffic early morning and into early evening). More importantly, I usually request courtyard side rooms when in Paris (especially for hotels on busy streets) and did so here, but on courtyard side of the building, the hotel faces a middle school. So if you plan on spending any time in the room in the morning after 8:30am or during the day, the courtyard side rooms will be very noisy, especially during recess when the kiddos all spill into the small area and start screaming. The night desk guy did try to sell us "special" tours and "dinners" which were overpriced tourist traps (and I'm sure he was getting a commission). This was annoying as he kept pushing these even after we told him directly we knew Paris well and were not interested.The other desk staff, however, were very friendly, professional, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - perfect for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: glassofred
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Airmiles for my daughter's 18th birthday treat. Despite this being a freebie (covered by Airmiles) - we were made to feel most welcomed and the hotel made no attempt to get us to upgrade to a more expensive room - and no need to. Great location - direct Metro from Gare du Nord. Nice size room and quiet location despite overlooking a large Blvd. Lots of nice restaurants just around the corner and fun Fondue restaurant just across the street! Excellent hotel staff, thank you Michel for taking such good care of us and recommending a nice restaurant in the Latin Qtr! Breakfast was very nice, typical Continental and never very busy. Decor of hotel and rooms was very modern,clean and soothing to the eye after a long day in Paris. We will definitely go back. Closest Metro stop is Vavin and is just 5 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starshine#1
Reviews.Content: I'm hoping this is also known as "Le Royal Montparnasse". I stayed over the New Year and the hotel was excellent - the location is superb - 20 minutes walk from Notre Dame, and very near 2 metro stations (the closest is Raspial) and an RER. The rooms are small, but well furnished, and the breakfast is as to be expected - toast, breads, yoghurts and so on - a cold buffet with some boiled eggs. There is internet access in the lobby and a comfortable waiting area. Dinner is not available but there is a little Italian bistro next door where the food is ok in taste, but the portions are large!
